title: Bug 104630: Column icons don't show up in connecting Derby database
description: The column icons fail to display when connecting to a Derby database in the specified scenario.
OB: Column icons are not visible in the Data Explorer view after setting up a Data Source to connect to a Derby database. The icons that typically represent different column types or attributes are missing.
EB: The expected behavior is that column icons should be displayed in the Data Explorer view when connecting to a Derby database. These icons aid users in quickly identifying and distinguishing various column types, enhancing the overall user experience.
SR:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a new project.
2. Generate a new report within the project.
3. In the Data Explorer view, create a new Data Source to connect to a Derby database using the following configuration:
   - Driver Class: com.ibm.db2.jcc.DB2Driver
   - Database URL: jdbc:db2://spmdb:1527/gui
   - User Name: root
   - Password: root
4. After configuring the Data Source, create a dataset.
5. In the 'Edit Data Set' window, select 'Query'.
6. Observe the absence of column icons in the Data Explorer view.
